page.title: 15Thurstonland Church.
page.content: St. Thomas's Church was built in 1870. It shares its vicar with Christ Church New Mill.Services are on three out of four Sundays monthly.The church spire is a well-known local landmark.The dioceson architects have decided it needs a thorough renovation.The roof,guttering,wiring,heating and decorating all need urgent attention.It is estimated that Â£8,000 will be needed and a target date of May 1988 has been set.At present about Â£2,000 has been raised.The committee co-ordinates fund raising efforts.These efforts are purely voluntary.They range from individuals holding parties and coffee mornings to grander events organised by the school(cycle ride)and the Clothiers Public House(Harvest Festival).These events bring the community together.
